meanings.def: a small device containing powder that burns or explodes and produces bright coloured lights and loud noises, used especially at celebrations
examples: (British English) to let off a few fireworks
(North American English) to set off a few fireworks
The firework spluttered and went out.
They set off fireworks in their back garden.
Thousands of people jammed into People’s Square to watch the fireworks.

meanings.def: strong or angry words; exciting actions
examples: There'll be fireworks when he finds out!
